caption: Wonderful service.....

I traveled to Chicago in 2002.. Waited for 4 hours before getting to Chicago Chop House . Better to have res in advance. Located next to deep dish rest Pizza Uno. I considered in 2002 this place as best in America in overall for aged stakes . Not for from famous Magnificent Mile Area . Chicago is not known only  for its notorious Chicago Fire and As center for Mafia in prohibition Era. In 1893 it held So called Chicago Columbian Expo Fair commemorating 400 years of C Colombus rediscovery of New World and America's . On shores Michigan there is still remnants of that Era reflected in it's Cultural Museums. Chicago still is second only to NY as having a Downtown type  lifestyle. High rise construction started here first rep in Flatiron building. It is always warm and lots of things to do in the Windy City.   RZED.
From the moment we were seated, this restaurant hit the spot on every level. Excellent.
Good food and good customer service!

Had an 845pm reservation this past Friday.  At 930pm we still had not placed a DRINK order.  Unacceptable.  Set our whole night back and we were then forced to call it a night and head to hotel.  $300 plus dinner and we were treated like second class citizens.  I’ve been here before and this experience was nothing like my first.  I’m still angry about our wasted night and blown plans.

New rules 2h limit per table, most of guests look like they ended up here by accident considering their outfits (super inappropriate) service and food 9 out of 10. Prices are ok not maybe for everyone's pocket but still ok.
The food was very good and our waiter Hector was awesome  !!!
Wonderful service from Joseph and we loved the vintage decor with pictures of people who built Chicago. We sat on the second floor and had a great view. Thanks again for making our Sunday wonderful
A must try in Chicago. A dining legend in the city.

Extremely juicy tender grand steak cooked perfectly to rare requests -must order with garlic butter-, maple glazed salmon was cooked to be flakey and still well hydrated, mashed Potatoes were just the PERFECT side, and everyone loves a pre-dinner bread with salted butter. All staff wore masks correctly and hand sanitizer on tables!
Great staff, lovely cozy restaurant, and the chateaubriand was cooked just right (I love when a chef knows what "medium well" actually means). Everything was delicious. We'll be back. :)

Service great but the NY Strip steak was hard, you really have to work at chewing. Two small pieces was all I could take. I gave the rest to my dog the next day. The fries were hard, very hard, asparagas was good, creamed spinach had no flavor with mozzarella cheese on top. Coffee good. Lollipop Lamb was excellent. Lobster bisque was bland, salt helped a bit but no... the taste wasn't there. Goat cheese with bacon too sweet for me but others seem to enjoy it. I hope your experience is better than mine. My fellow dinners were top notch.
Perfection!!
It was my first time, the food is okay, but the service was awesome!! sometimes the service can be so good you can't even remember the test of the food overall awesome stuff member👍
Very nice restaurant small intimate setting you can have a conversation music isn't too loud also candle light. Overall great place.
The food and service was great.    Next time I'm trying the Rib Eye.  Oh and next time i want my Salmon Flame Broiled like the Steaks. I love that flame taste.
The food was excellent, it was a very relaxing place with music back in the 60's - 70's and the service was superb.
Great service and food

I have been twice everything was delicious on both occasions. My family and I were there yesterday for brunch. The steak and eggs were great as well as the strawberry French toast. Let me just say JB was AMAZING. We will definitely be back.
Amazing food, wonderful atmosphere, there was a nice gentleman playing piano as live music.
Excellent service and food
Finest decor and ambience. Truly love this food!
Fantastic food, fantastic service, fantastic atmosphere. You should go here. Everyone should.
One of the few true Chicago style chop houses left in the city. You need to visit this place it will take you through Chicago history!

Wow  Just wow. The chophouse was recommended by a friend of mine and boy am I glad that I went here. Ended up making a last minute reservation through google and it was simple. Within 30 minutes we walked over to the chophouse and had our table ready. We had Janae as our waitress and I’m so glad we did because she made our whole experience. You know I’m not really that big into spending money on food because at the end of the day it’s going to be eaten and last for only an hour at max. Janae went through the entire dry vs wet steak and we decided to go big or home so we went for the tomahawk steak and I do not regret it at all. The size of the tomahawk and the texture was incredible. I can’t even really put it into words on how good it was.  Just go to chophouse and get the tomahawk if you’re into dry aged. If not then idk what you’re doing. Oh we also got a side of the bacon cheddar mashed potatoes but we devoured the steaks that we didn’t have room for the sides.
Very special place! Great steak!
Best stack I've ever had in my life. Service was outstanding with a great atmosphere. I would love to go back.

Dined here on Valentine’s Day for dinner. They seemed to overbook the restaurant. It was getting a bit hectic. We saw a lot of angry customers with what seemed like no manager presence anywhere. The staff was left to fend for themselves, or so it appeared. But I have to give 5 stars because.. A. I didn’t have any problems with my table or wait for a table. B. The food was excellent. Best steak and seafood I’ve had.  And C. Saved the best for last here, Hector was an OUTSTANDING waiter. His section was outside in the tent. People kept getting seated out there and moving back into the restaurant because they were too cold. We actually felt bad for the servers that were out there. But let me tell you, Hector is a true professional. Great attitude and top notch service. In fact, it was the best service we’ve had in a long time. The busboy was very efficient too. The whole staff all seemed to being doing their best. I give them all a lot of credit. We will definitely be returning.
Waited like an hour after being seated to even get drink orders taken but the food was beyond great. Just avoid the pineapple juice, it's the can.
Other restaurants should take note, this establishment is quality all round, never disappointed eating here.
Very nice place, great food and atmosphere. Fine dining at it's best!
Great vibe inside the chop house and the steaks are marvelous as well as the sides

We had the aged dry petite filet and the aged wet filet.  While both were delicious, we recommend the dry. The sautéed asparagus was fresh and just as delicious. Mushrooms are highly recommended.  Service was excellent! A 7 on my martini but the wine was a perfect choice. Dessert was scrumptious
Awesome!
Great food and environment.

Old school steakhouse in decor, music and overall style. Fantastic food, low key service (they are there but in a quiet way, letting food speak for itself and the music take you back to a different time). Upstairs is a bit more quiet, but I've enjoyed my time by the bar as well. Fantastic steaks (recently tried the delmonico) and I can't say enough good things about the french onion soup.

Food was AMAZING. This was our first visit and Janee was the most pleasant server we have had in a while. It was a bit more expensive than we are used to but worth it. We went for out 28th anniversary and will return.
Rosemary Fried chicken...delicious...honey sauce with asparagus. Amazing waitress and staff!
The food was good but serve was horrible
My #1 favorite steakhouse in the world.  Every time I’m in Chicago I have to stop in.  Best steaks I’ve ever had.  Old school atmosphere makes this a classic!
Nikoli and Johnny provided great service! They made my friends and I feel beyond welcomed on our girls night. This has become my favorite spot to visit with my friends.
Great service food great.

Hadn't been there since the 80's when they had "New York type seating." Tables are spaced out more. Cozy with a speakeasy look. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Owner even ate there with his "friend" (woo woo!). Had a leisurely meal with co-workers. Drinks, appetizers, soups, steaks ( of course), more drinks, dessert. Had petit fillet, dry-aged - tasty but could have been rarer. Asparagus and mashed potatoes were good, can't go wrong there. Key Lime pie was fine. Go there for the ambiance and history of the place. Go for the Chicago-ness of it.
Fantastic meal great service

Buuuutttt!! On December 31st, 2020, due to Covid, the city was limited to outside dining only. Which in turn created these outside dining tents. It was freezing outside. 30 degrees 🥶. Propane heaters and propane blast heaters were all they had to keep us warm and it was not enough for the weather. For what we payed this was not acceptable. I know, we could've canceled and went somewhere else but we were in town for a short time. And nothing wise was any better. At least we were able to sit down and eat a meal as a family. I was very disappointed. Listen, It was so cold, that a couple next to me, my wife and daughter asked for the heat to be directly on them. Cause the man's feet was freezing. Lol, they put the heat right on his feet. Lmao, this experience was crazy to say the least but I get it. What can they do? Otherwise it was a great meal. We made the best of it and went back to our hotel 🙄 Definitely will visit when the times get better.
Crab Benedict is excellent. The staff ,awesome.
I ordered the wagyu burger for pickup.  They forgot the fries! Crazy!  Thank you for the response.  No fries at all arrived in the order.  Not one set or second set, none at all.

Noah was absolutely amazing! By far the best waiter I have ever had. He recommended everything and he was spot on like we had the same taste buds!!! His personality is awesome, super professional, and very helpful! Come here get the lamb chops single cut with the truffle Mac! And be sure to ask for Noah’s section!!!
If this place isn’t in your top 3 places to eat, you probably haven’t been there yet!
Porterhouse & wagyu meatball awesome Excellent services. Special mention to Heber
Excellent food and service provided!
Bad Service an Food!
Great service, good food, great company
Best place to eat ever!
Worst tomahawk steak I have ever had,  thin like a sheet of paper! Not to mention pre sliced, without giving the option to do it ourselves. Overly priced for what you get.

One of the worst dining experiences of my life. The services was horrible and frankly the server was intimidating and patronizing towards us. He offered all the tables around us a basket of bread, but did not offer it to us. The filet was the saddest piece of meat I’ve had in my life. The salmon tasted fishy and definitely was not fresh. Everything is so overpriced for the quality that is served up.
Had a bad experience with the service,  but the food was good. I'm only returning because the manager reached out and offered a credit. I will be updating my review after my visit.
Warm tent with festive holiday decor.   Friendly and attentive service with very good food. Wagyu burger and potatoes were great
Outstanding went for Christmas brunch

This is a really nice restaurant to enjoy some delicious food. First off they did a good job providing a comfortable atmosphere to "dine outside". It was a bit warm initially but soon it all balanced out. Our server did a really awesome job taking care of us throughout the evening. He was very kind and attentive. The wet aged delmonico was cooked to perfection, along with the lamb chops. They served pretty decent drinks as well. We had a really good time and experience with this establishment. We are looking forward to our next night out there to see what other dishes to try. Glad they were able to deliver on our expectations. Kudos to the chef.

Food was huge and delicious, we felt safe while dining in the tent that was heated with sufficient airflow (was my biggest concern).  We appreciated how they made us feel we were in a fall courtyard with grass, white linen tables and all.  They had a Santa playing tunes to keep us entertained.  The staff was wonderful and excellent friendly customer service.

Everyone checked on us constantly. The food was wonderful i finished every last bite so did my boyfriend. It was a wonderful time away from this Pandemic. The outdoor set up was beautiful and i felt comfortable and safe. Thank you J.B for serving us you made our visit memorable.
Very nice atmosphere and great food
Good burger

More than I've ever paid for a steak, but I don't visit steakhouses too often. I can confidently tell you this is the best filet that I've ever had in my life and my wife says that even the chicken is good - which may indicate that this steakhouse does everything well.

Do you want to talk about a spectacular historic place right in the middle of downtown Chicago then we are talking about the chophouse we're talking about incredible food great Aviance.  Don't worry about parking because they have inexpensive valet parking. Let's go into more detail about how fantastic the menu is and how great the food is, unbelievable this is truly a gem in Chicago.  If you want to bring a smile to the face of someone very special to you this is definitely the place to make an impression. Very friendly staff. Make this a restaurant destination
The food is excellent. Steaks are perfectly seared and cooked exactly as ordered. Veggies are also excellent as is the service and atmosphere. 100% great!
Great outdoor dining with lots of patio heaters.
COVID-19 is affecting a lot of things including the service at this fine restaurant. Having to move dining outside has taken its toll. Food however is still perfect and I won't stop coming back.
Best meal of my life. Such a dining experience.  At the top on my list!
Took a friend for his birthday and we enjoyed the food and ambience. Customer service was great from the moment we arrived. Will go back.

Chicago Chop House has a lovely set up for outdoor dining. The weather was great last night! We enjoyed the Wagyu beef burgers. These did not need a lot of condiments to enjoy. The burger was juicy without the heavy greasy taste or texture. It was a simple, enjoyable meal.
My friends and I celebrate every major event here! We love food!

I was very disappointed with the quality of the food and experience here. Chop House has been on my list for some time and they did not deliver.  We had multiple issues with our visit - Awful wine menu, everything we wanted was not available. It was potentially the worse wine menu I’ve seen - Stale, cold, dry bread. Gross. - Disgusting French onion soup - Tables were sat very close, even during COVID. The dinning room was basically empty on one side and crowded on the other - Very salty food - as if we were eating at McDonalds next door  There were a few good things: the service was great. The dessert (crepe brûlée) was delicious, and the lamb chops were cooked perfectly.  I will not return or provide a recommendation for anyone to visit here.
Probably the best steak ive had!!
My Love and I's first time there and We enjoyed ourselves,and my food was fye!!!
Great food, great atmosphere.

Seriously, the best food I have ever eaten. My boyfriend and I ate here for Thanksgiving, the staff made us feel like we were the only ones in the restaurant. I have never had an experience like this anywhere else. They gave us a free ride back to our hotel in a luxurious black tinted suv. We felt like royalty and they will have us as customers for life. Do not skip visiting this place while in Chicago, it's worth every penny.
One of Chicago's finest restaurants. You will not be disappointed, excellent service, friendly staff you will definitely enjoy your experience.

I have to say, this was the worst meal I have EVER paid for.. and paid SO much for. If you’re currently searching these reviews to figure if you should eat here or not, I beg you to listen to someone with tastebuds and give this place a HARD pass. My boyfriend and I made reservations well in advance and as we arrive are left standing at the front for 15 mins as the hostess let others in before us, mind you we also asked for patio AND told them to make special note it was for a birthday dinner, which was not even acknowledges, was seated upstairs even after we told her we asked for patio. Was seated and it took up to 15 mins to even be acknowledged. Got our drinks that were EXTREMELY watered down which is just sad/ embarrassing for an upscale restaurant. French onion soup was served to us with half the soup and cheese covering the outside of the bowl as well as the cheese being almost rock hard. We then order a grand filet and a salmon, which are both very pricey and would not mind paying for good food, however without even taking the first bite, visually we were already disgusted. As I was eating the salmon, i picked THREE bones out of my mouth... classless. There was water and oil all over our plates, not even wiped. Again usually things like this are not a big deal, but an expensive restaurant like this should not have food coming out like a kirbys Coney Island. The steak and salmon ABSOLUTELY lacked any sort of seasoning to the point it was laughable. I asked for salt and pepper and was given salt and pepper PACKETS.... we also ordered mashed potatoes that were extremely cold when at our table and legit just had paprika on the top, nothing else. I would rather eat instant potatoes than that sad dish. We told our waiter about them and was given an odd look and response of “...cold?” Like we were lying. Overall i was EXTREMELY disappointed with not only the food, the service, but also the VALET! They had ONE man who was whipping the cars down the road, leaving crowds of us to wait 20 mins for our cars. If you are a old couple with no tastebuds, be my guest, other than that...need I say more about this sad establishment?

Before making reservations I heard all but great reviews about this restaurant so I wanted to take my wife out for our anniversary here and I made reservation a week before, upon arriving the host was trying to find us a table and even though we asked for patio they had us sit inside which was not a big deal. After being seated for 15 minutes still no sign of the server we had to flag someone down to get served. We ordered the wet aged tomahawk steak and the charred salmon and with many other sides including mash potatoes and French onion soup, the food was one of the worst I have ever had which I prefer going to a Coney Island and paying 1/4 of the price I payed here. The steak was dry and our salmon had bones and was not charred, including the Mash potatoes which had just paprika and was cold. When acknowledging the server about the situation he gave us the dirty look and said no it’s not, so I asked for my check and went out to eat at maple and ash where they provided excellent service. To top it all off the valet driver which was handled by one person on a Saturday night!! It took almost 30 min to bring our car. Don’t waste your time and MONEY.
Great service

Overall was not at all impressed with this place. we ordered the oysters as an appetizer which were pretty good, from there it went down hill. The service was slow, the steaks were not priced to match the taste, they lacked any flavor, even with garlic butter! Ordered a small lobster tail on the side which was overcooked. The Mac and cheese was ok and the desserts were unimpressive.
The food was delicious.  The owner is very nice. The atmosphere was warm and cozy.

I had a wonderful experience. The temperature, presentation and taste of the food was great. I had a special request that my waiter and the management went above and behind to fulfill for me. My boyfriend and I will definitely be back for future date nights.

Was able to get last minute reservations and was not disappointed. Shared a tomahawk ribeye that was delicious.... We did send it back because it wasnt how we ordered it, but they were super accommodating and it came back perfect. Sides were good and big servings.
We went for my birthday and the food was really good. The service sucks. We waited almost twenty minutes to place our order. The key lime pie for desert was great.
Excellent food and great service. I appreciate the effort they've made to maintain social distancing.

Disappointed from start to finish! Sat there for easily 20 minutes before someone came to our table, then waited 15mins to place order, then to end it the server forgot to put in my entree so that was it to end a bad experience there!
By far the best steak in Chicago!!!! I had a petite fillet wet marinated for 24 days!!!
Disappointed 😞
Nice location to meet with family. I will be back with my friends. The bill was appropriate.
I Love everything about this place especially they Steak and they Bacon
Excellent place. Great food. Great service
Good food
Excellent food and atmosphere. The food portions are over the top!
Service was good but the food was not. I ordered a dry aged steak and it was not good, poor quality and overcooked.
Best steak house in CHI
I really enjoyed this doot. Tomahawk steak was melt in the mouth goodness. The mac and cheese was good too. Worth the money.

Celebrated my bd here, one of the best steak I've ever tried! Service always with a smile, quick and proffessional. Owner approached me, and gave me old gun from wall so I can take photo! Very entertaining and exciting night! Worth every$!

The time we spent here is from March 7th 2020. One of our last dates before the mandatory quarantine. I always wanted to come here and it DID DISAPPOINT!!  It started with our server ....she came and introduced herself and that WAS IT !! 17 minutes later and no water ....no bread ...no nothing !!! Another waiter had to get us water and bread . We could tell that our server was having a bad day....BUT THATS NOT OUR PROBLEM, we all have bad days at work but find a way to power through it . The service was poor though out our visit .  My food and drinks were good !! Food = 8 (10 highest) Drinks = 8 Service = 3 (2 from our server and 8 from the other server and busser )  As we was leaving my wife expressed our experience with the manager and she told us to come back and promised that the experience would be different....she was nice but I forgot her name .
Traveled the world, eaten at some of the top spots in the US - this is by far the best traditional steak house there is.  If you want the best steak and are in Chicago, make it a point to eat here.
Great service and amazing food
Loved it!!!!

From walking in to leaving we were treated as honored guests. Dominic was mindful and the gentleman helping him was also a silent presence making sure our glasses stayed full and our dishes were cleared at just the right time. We were there for a special occasion and were treated well in that regard as well. Would highly recommend. We did make reservations in advance so were seated quickly and we were in a nice cozy location. :-) Oh!! BEST Asparagus I have EVER eaten!! No kidding. I ate 4 before I remembered to eat my steak!
Expensive but worth it
(Translated by Google) Fffff gallery very good  (Original) Fffff galeriamuy bien
First time I tried dry aged steak. Delicious. You need to try it. All round excellent restaurant.
Food was good, service was ok. The experience overall was not what I was expecting coming from this type of restaurant considering $$
Service was excellent. Patrick the new beverage manager was very passionate and helpful
Amazing food, kind and helpful service, wonderful place to wine and dine.
Great food, great service. A bit pricey considering the lack the a la carte aspect of the entrees, but the food was magnificent!
Definition of fine dining and service. Amazing steak! But what wowed me was the service. A must if you are a steak fanatic!

This place was so good! Our waiter Tony was extremely polite n helpful, everyone was so attentive. The food was phenomenal, by far the best scallops I've ever had, the steak was heavenly. Definitely pricey but worth it. I loved coming here, we ordered the dry-aged ribeye, scallops, and truffle Mac n cheese
Good steak

(Translated by Google) Chicago has many delicious steakhouses, but this is a memorable one. Big thing about Tomahawk steak! Later, I knew that I could share it with some people, but I ate it alone. Dessert style and Chicago size. Everything looked delicious.  (Original) シカゴは美味しいステーキハウスが多いのですが、此処は記憶に残る店です。トマホークステーキの大きなこと！あとで何人かで分けてたべてもいいことを知りましたが😰1人で完食しました。デザートの選べるスタイルで、しかもシカゴサイズ。どれも美味しそうでした。
Overall rd food. I requested medium well, more towards well, but had to send my meat back since it was very red. The manager was very personable and accomodating.
Pricey, but excellent food.  Good presentation and terrific service.
Good to go. Love it love it yes I love it.

[Dined here Dec. 24th, 2019]  The Chicago Chop House is Chicagoland's tier one steakhouse. My family and I had an incredible Christmas Eve dinner here, and I cannot decide which I enjoyed more: the food or the ambiance. While the meat products are clearly of a high caliber (I strongly recommend either the Tomahawk Ribeye or the Petite NY Strip), it was the side dishes that really sealed the deal for me.  Be certain to try the truffle mac and cheese, steamed spinach, or any of the seafood options should you visit the Chop House!
Love it
(Translated by Google) Deli ... 🥩 👍  (Original) Deli... 🥩 👍
(Translated by Google) Good food and fantastic service  (Original) Dobre jedzenie i fantastyczna obsługa
My goto steakhouse whenever I visit Chicago. The setting is real old-school steakhouse. The service is fast and attentive and the steaks are awesome! Vallet parking is available.
Another Chicago delicacy!
Very very nice food  expansive yes put its worth it

Had NYE dinner here. Nice drink special with the Moet. Hard to find a reasonably priced bottle of decent wine. So went with the Manhattan and it was excellent. Had the dinner special of filet and lobster tails. It was supposed to be 2 tails but it looked like 1 1/2 tails from 1/2 lbs lobsters. As a New Englander I should have known better than order lobster in Chicago. Steak was cooked perfect - black and blue - which many places get wrong. Service was good but felt a but pushy. Kind of used car salesman type of behavior. Atmosphere isn't romantic but is casual and relaxing. I've spent more at steak houses and gotten equally good food and spent less and gotten equally good food.
New Year's Eve dinner was fabulous...service was amazing and food was fantastic.

This restaurant is my favorite restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I prefere it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to visit this place. Whenever  I I need a good lunchon, this restaurant comes straight to my mind. fresh and varied  food and a rich cuisine.great staff members, and agreeable atmosphere. And very important, the price is fair. I sent my friends to this restaurant with pleasure.
Amazing Diner! Birthday Diner! Had the Japanese Beef and it was good!
PERFECT..DELICIOUS..FRIENDLY.. ACCOMMODATING
Had a great experience tonight! The food was amazing and the wait staff was super attentive! Had the best Christmas dinner ever!

Majorly overpriced. There are far better steaks out there for less money.  The tables are so awkward that your feet don’t fit between the table and the booth.  If you want a decent steak for lots of money, go here. If you want a great steak, go somewhere else.
Solid steak house, good atmosphere

Had an excellent time for our anniversary dinner! Jodi W. was an incredible server! Appetizers were amazing! The lobster escargot was perfect! The bone in dry aged ribeye were done to perfection. (Medium rare as it should be). Will definitely be coming back again! Merry Christmas!
Quality food, good service.  Casual atmosphere, I ordered the tomahawk steak & it was delicious.
Excessively overpriced, slow service. Had to keep reminding the staff that our table existed, as they seem to have forgotten about us several times through the meal.  Spend your money elsewhere.

Chef Martin is a master at his craft. His passion was obvious when he brought the premium cuts out to our table and spent some time with us before preparing them. I have a high level of respect for chef Martin and we had a wonderful time with Antonio, Edgar and The Boss... Charlie.
Consistently Brilliant - Steaks, Wine & Service
Great place and quiet place
(Translated by Google) Delicious!!!  (Original) Delicioso!!!

This is a high end steakhouse and had everything you'd expect.   Food was excellent, wait staff attentive but not intrusive.   Steaks perfect, side dishes amazing. I had a dry aged ribeye, others had a tomahawk ribeye... only get that if you're really hungry. Prices were what you'd expect from a top end steakhouse. Well worth the price.

(Translated by Google) The best place in chicago for a wonderful dinner and a variety of cuts and dishes and top quality staff  (Original) El mejor lugar de chicago para una cena maravillosa y gran variedad de cortes y platillos y el personal de primera calidad

We had reservations for a party of 5 business associates.  We were about 5 minutes late and were seated on the third floor about 5 minutes after we arrived.  We get water right away but had a lengthy wait for drinks.  It was an hour before we asked the manager if we could please order at least an appetizer.  The appetizers arrived and were disappointing.  The $24 charcuterie board had 3 pieces of bread,  3 pieces of meat and perhaps 3 oz of cheese along with a couple strawberries, raspberries and perhaps 10 blueberries.  Maybe $7 worth of food.  I ordered the dry aged porterhouse prepared medium, it was served rare so I sent it back and when it was returned it was tough and dry.  But after waiting an hour and 45 minutes, I just ate it.  The sides were good but that's about the only positive thing I can say about this meal.  I have been here before and had a fantastic meal.  I'm not sure what happened but i hope it was a fluke and not the new norm.  No one at the table had a great meal which is disappointing and unacceptable for a $$$$ establishment.

Got here and we were seated. No body came to our table. We had to flag them down. They just walked by us like we were not here. NOT A GOOD START. 30 minutes...and waiting. 5 more minutes and we are leaving! UNBELIEVABLE! HORRIBLE SERVICE! We are OUT THE DOOR!  Even tried to speak to the manager. He had no time to talk to us. We were there to celebrate a birthday. So much for that!
Pricey but worth it. They have a good happy hour. Timeless and classic. Amazing staff.
I literally had the worst steak in my life.
Excellent service.  Highly recommend

Overall, the food is pretty good but it's really expensive. I guess we were early but we were there on a Friday. We left after 6:39 and they still weren't busy. We ordered steak and had to order sides separately. As I said, the food was good, but there are a lot of places that serve good food--including steak--that would be better and cheaper. In my opinion it wasn't worth it.
Best steakhouse in town
(Translated by Google) The exquisite cuts, good variety of drinks and the first attention.  (Original) Los cortes exquisitos,  buena variedad de bebidas y la atención de primera.
Great tasting steaks!
Top notch steakhouse.   Staff, service,  and food second to none
Good steak house & quality cocktails.  Typical menu for this kind of place.  Food was cooked properly and tasty.  The service was great!  Attentive but not overbearing and very friendly!

(Translated by Google) A very pleasant atmosphere that evokes the atmosphere of the 1920s. Staff professional and nice, the food quality very high. On the ground floor there is a piano player and the walls are photographs of people who have contributed to the glory of Chicago, including the mayor of Antonín Čermák. Definitely worth a visit.  (Original) Velmi příjemná atmosféra, která evokuje atmosféru dvacátých let minulého století. Personál profesionální a milý, kvalita jídla velice vysoká. V přízemí hraje pan na piano a stěnách jsou fotografie lidí, kteří se zasloužili o slávu Chicaga, včetně starosty Antonína Čermáka. Rozhodně stojí za návštěvu.
Excellent service. Amazing steak. Seafood starter looked amazing. Good selection of wine.
Amazing atmosphere, phenomenal service, exquisite food! If I could give 10 stars I would!  Happy hour is also amazing!

Be ready to spend $700 in this place.  If I ever had the opportunity to have have dinner with God this is where I will go.  Exceptional service, this is place that always makes me travel back in time to opulence and reminds me what life should be.
Amazing steaks in a classy setting 🎹

Went to dinner with a big group. Three of us got gin martinis. After the first round we all said to one another that it tasted weird but ya know, everyone makes them different so we ordered the second round and asked for no vermouth and it came back and still tasted the same... we said we asked for no vermouth and the server was taken aback by the fact that we even questioned it... then the manager came back and told us that the bartender was using syrup in our martinis instead of olive juice..... for $15 a pop. Then she gave us like free shots of lemon drops........ and she took one with us. Would have rather have them taken off our bill. The food was also not the best. Way better steaks in Chicago to try
Uncomfortable table by bar...was bumped every time bartender left his station.  Food was over cooked ..steak and onion rings especially.  Friendly staff
Old school steakhouse with solid cuts.
FANTASTIC...GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE

I took my girlfriend here and the service we received was EXTREMELY disappointing. The steak we ordered (dry aged tomahawk) was under cooked and rather send it back, we opted to take the remaining meat home to further cook thoroughly. They took our food to box it, but during the process they tossed the raw pieces into the garbage (about 1/3 of the steak) and gave us back the remaining. We politely asked the server where the remaining of the steak was. They were unsure and had the manager talk to us. She (the manager) accused us of lying after she 'investigated' the situation. She refused to be accommodating and honestly didn't want to help or address the situation. At one point, she went to further investigate with the staff and never returned.  AVOID this steak house! Go to Gibsons, Benny's, Mastros, even outback steak house will provide a more pleasant experience!
Amazing steaks great appetizers fantastic Waiter it couldn't have been any better and the desserts were so good all of the food was amazing
Great steaks superb service. A little pricy but an experience in good dining
The quality seems to have went down I used to love this place

I have been there at least a dozen times in the last 5 years.... average twice a year. I love it. Food is great, nice ambience... cool decorations. Chicago is full of very nice stake houses, so it is hard to say its one of the best.... it is for me.... but... Never been disappointed. Took many friends there and all love it... I wil be back... for sure

It's a good restaurant not the best restaurant. Had filet mignon and it was good, but a bit overcooked. Mashed potatoes or excellent but spinach broccoli was mediocre. Desserts were good but basic. You can find an infinitely better filet mignon at Elliott's Seafood Grille in Edison Park.
What can I say about this wonderful steakhouse, from the high quality steak and seafood to our outstanding Waiter George, wish they had additional stars to give!
Service, food, atmosphere well above expectations.   Would recommend to everyone.   We will be back our next trip to Chicago.
Nice decor, the walls are full of Chicago's history. Food was good.

The food was amazing; some of the best shrimp I’ve ever had! Everything was nicely seasoned! The waiter was awesome, professional, and polite! He went out of his way to make sure we were happy. The owner came out to greet us and was very friendly. They even gave us a complementary ride back to our hotel! I would highly recommend this restaurant and I can’t wait to go back!

Awesome steaks!! We went to the chicago chop house for my husbands birthday and we really enjoyed our dinner.Our host Noza was very knowledgable and friendly. For sides we had scallops and calamari. Yum!! Definitely worth the money!

Came here for my father's birthday, and I must say it is an experience. So much Chicago history in this building. Noza, our waitress, was extremely knowledgeable and very friendly. One of the best steaks I've ever had, and we've hit almost all the major steakhouses in Chicago over the last 26 years. Nikola, the manager was also extremely pleasant and very interactive with all the guests. This place is worth every penny.

So, to start off - would I go in on a busy night and eat at the restaurant? Probably not. It is small and the tables looked relatively close together.  On the other hand, as an out-of-towner who ordered there by mistake (thought they were the grill chop house across from my hotel on w monroe), and who struggled to rush to the place my cab to pickup my prime rib and massive potato, I am very pleased.  Yes, it was an expensive meal. I'd argue that's a side effect of real estate prices in this city (maybe?), but I saw the menu and ordered for pickup anyway. The food was really done right (I'm super picky about my steaks) and warm in spite of the 7 or 8 blocks in traffic each direction via cab.  Bonus: I didn't know but they have a house car and will come and pick you up. They treat you like royalty and make you feel good about the $50-$75/person meal (before drinks and tips). If the price isn't an issue, I think you'll be thankful for the meal.  :)  Update June 2019: I went back to Chicago Chop House, and I think it may just be a regular stop for my trips to the city going forward. The staff is very friendly and in my last visit while waiting for my order (to go), we had a fun laugh about the interesting photo shoot someone was doing out on the street/near the front of the building.  I hope to get back again soon.

(Translated by Google) For those who like dry aged meats, it's worth it. Great atmosphere and excellent service  (Original) Pra quem gosta de carnes dry aged, vale a pena. Ambiente ótimo e atendimento excelente
The atmosphere got going later in the night and the food was rich and delicious

Fantastic steak. You pay through the nose but, once in a while, it is worth it. I salivate just thinking about their prime rib. Mine was three inches thick, eight inches wide and 6 inches long. I only ordered a salad with it while the two others with me ordered steaks, potatoes and salads. One drink each. Over 400,00 for the three of us. Way out of my league but it was superb.

My wife and I had an excellent experience!  Our server, Todd, helped us to understand the options and select two very good meals.   We also found the perfect wine for the steaks, a St. Francis Merlot 2008.  Overall excellent meal and experience... we will definitely be back!

The food was not terrible.  But for $150 a plate the steak should be cooked right and be prime beef.  Our steaks were neither. I had the bone in ribeye my wife had the filet. I ordered mine medium rare and got it medium well, raw (they tried to cook another one and it was cold in the center with white fat) and medium.  My wife ordered her steak medium and got it rare.  The brussel sprouts were raw.  But what made the whole thing a fiasco, was the meat was not prime.  It was choice.  I have had more tender beef at Longhorn.  We won't be back.  You should not go here.
Always love it! Excellent food and service!
Expensive, great atmosphere and food. Service is impeccable

My wife and I have enjoyed many memorable meals together, but this one bordered on unforgettable.  The level of care, education, and creative suggestions were so far superior to what we expect - even at very upscale restaurants.  Perhaps it was because we were dining early (5:30 pm to make a show) but we were waited on expertly by Julian and Noza - each partner sharing their expertise in everything from cocktail and wine selection to appetizer, side dish and main course preparations and selections to fit our unique tastes.  They made us feel like we were their most important diners, even as the restaurant became more and more busy.  My wife recommends you try the Pomegranate Martini and the Old Fashioned I enjoyed matched the rich, old-world atmosphere we were enjoying.  Steaks were prepared to perfection and the evening was magical.  Our compliments to the waitstaff, the bartenders and the chef!

We both had the mushrooms for a starter (generous portion perfect to share. Pair with the complementary bread because that sauce is fantastic) and prime rib. I requested it prepared medium rare and my partner requested theirs to be prepared medium well. We waited over an hour and 30 minutes. The server checked in an appropriate amount while we waited and brought us more bread when we requested. We weren't in a hurry and weren't upset by the  wait, although we WERE hungry.
Great steaks and a very friendly staff.

Given their reputation, I expected more. EXTREMELY slow service and confused wait staff. They kept filling my water glass, apparently thinking I wouldn't notice the lack of food.  Their NY Strip was one of the most tasteless pieces of beef I have had in years. My friends ordered one rare, one medium rare, and mine was too be medium. They all came out exactly the same. By that time we were all so hungry we would have eaten a live cow. Save yourselves some money and eat somewhere else.
Delicious
Great experience here with top quality food service and drinks!
Ate here on my last trip and am eating there on my next trip to... CHICAGO!

Stopped in for a drink, the gentleman at the door and the maitre d were so welcoming! A lot of unique history inside. Menu is on the pricey side, but based on the warm welcome we received just for stopping in, we'll be sure to return again.
Guys, take notes! If ever in Chicago Rudely asked to leave while having our desserts... due to reservation ....big no no..
Customer Service and Food was Great! A little pricey.

Excellent food, but a disappointing overall experience. We were seated next to a table of eight, several of whom were intoxicated, loud, and using the F word liberally. Four of them left the building twice for a "smoke break." We could see them smoking marijuana on the sidewalk in front of the restaurant. Our servers were so busy dealing with this obnoxious table that they had little time for us. Perhaps the restaurant can't be held responsible for the behavior of their customers, but we were also customers. We did not enjoy the atmosphere and service was not up to standards. We have dined at this restaurant several times, appreciate the excellent food, but probably won't be back. For the price of dinner at this restaurant, they need to ring all the bells in order to deliver value. They failed for us tonight.
Best steak I have ever had! Nothing comes close to Chicago Chop House ❤️
Great food, should be for the price though

The wine and sides were good, for the steaks, not so much. The steaks were cooked unevenly, smelled old, and tasted of nothing. The price is out of proportion for the low quality being served, ranging around $50-$70 on average. The Chop House sadly does not live up to its reputation anymore. In fact, I have had better steaks and my local pub.  I recommend spending your money elsewhere, seriously, there are plenty of good steak houses in this city. We were four people and none of us had a good steak tonight, in a place that specializes on steaks.  One star is for the atmosphere and one star is for the sides and wine.

Wait staff is excellent.  Very attentive, and courteous.  I really expected the food to be better.  This place sadly does not compare to chain steakhouses.  The 51 dry age tomahawk rib eye did not taste dry aged at all. The quantaty of the steak and the portions of the sides were lacking. Only 2 potato pancakes for over $12 and the spinach was really only enough for 1. Also, they have a small fruit fly problem that is on every table.   I guess it came out with the food.  They need to up their game and not rest on their history or location. For the prices they charge, they should be embarrassed.  I guess why this place is empty! Flemings was cheaper and so much better quality and value for your money.
Very slow in the kitchen but food was great
Amazing historical steak joint

New ownership has placed Chicago Chop House back up among the likes of Bavette's, Joe's, Chicago Cut, and Gibsons. Steaks: great aged bone in ribeye, amazing wagyu tomahawk steak. Sides: great au gratin potatoes, asparagus was okay. Apps: crab cake was really good. Desserts: key lime pie was best I've ever had, creme brulee cheesecake was also delicious. Staff was on point and the atmosphere had character.
I cherish the fact this restaurant is iconic but those LED lights I had to eat dinner under the spotlight I'm out
Perfect.
Hidden Gem
Good date night restaurant, excellent steaks, attentive waitstaff, more intimate old school style place.
(Translated by Google) Very good cuts!  (Original) Muy buenos cortes!!!
The steak and wine !! SIMPLY awesome.
it was so fresh. i look forward to going back again.
Steak was the best around and the service was as good as you could ever dream.
Service  and food is always  top notch

I was extremely disappointed with the service and am confused how they are able to charge such high prices for such horrible service. The food was fine, but the experience of dining at a steakhouse in Chicago is all about the experience. I felt as though no one in the restaurant cared about us as customers, besides the bar tender downstairs. We had to wait an entire half hour to even receive menus, and had to ask for them after waiting so long. We also had to ask again for our drinks after another 20 minutes. The menu was never explained to us, while all couples around us received thorough explanation of the various steak options. Our server, Joe, told us steak is "good". That was it. Since it was Valentine's Day, all couples around us received a dessert on the house. We were never given that option. The entire night almost felt like a joke. Why were we selected to receive terrible service while everyone around us was waited on hand & foot? I emailed the owner a month ago, and haven't heard back. I called last night to confirm the owner's email address. The manager proceeded to tell me he can only relay information to the owner and hung up on me. I hope this restaurant reevaluates some things because I will never recommend Chicago Chop House to anyone and regret our decision of spending our holiday with them.
Great food and great atmosphere. Steak was perfect.
Get the dry rubbed steak... Indescribable
Great food

I went here last night with a group of friends. We ordered 4 of the largest steaks they had. Overall they were really good, especially the porterhouse. The tomahawk ribeye for the price was not worth it in our opinion. This place has a unique decor but is a bit small and noisy. The wine list is egregiously priced. It is barely approachable and affordable wines are limited. I have lived in Chicago for the last 12 years and this was my first time here. I’d recommend other steak locations before the Chicago chophouse though. But if your in that specific area it’s worth a stop in to check it out.

Great food. Had the scallop appetizer, very good. My husbands steak he said was one of the best he has had. The dessert was THE BEST. Really enjoyed the key lime pie. The service was wonderful, very attentive to my husbands gluten allergy and provided complimentary dessert for our birthdays. One star off as the ambiance could have been better, loud intoxicated gentleman at the bar and tables in very close proximity. The meal was fantastic otherwise.
The best steak I have ever had.  You know your meats and are looking for those dry and aged subtle tastes go no further. Totally worth the money.
This is my favorite steak house in the US. Once again they demonstrated why. Over 15 years and always the same, perfect.
(Translated by Google) Just delicious there only to recommend who visited Chicago  (Original) Einfach nur lecker dort nur zum empfehlen wer Chicago besucht

Honestly this was a horrible experience from the start. Texas roadhouse is better. If you want to wait 30 minutes passed your reservation pay 15 dollars for hungry Jack instant potatoes and a poorly cooked $75 steak then this is your place but if you want to actually enjoy yourself just go to trulucks dont waste your time at this overpriced McDonalds.

We reserved a banquet room in November fo my mom's  79th birthday dinner. I flew in from Stlanta, others from Dallas, Charlotte, and from all over the Chicagoland area.  My sister came in several weeks before to  do a walk through with management. She called saturday to make sure everything was set. We get there on saturday and they had given our room away. We had about 50 people.  The manager made no concessions or offered any explanation except to say I'm sorry.  They put us in the dining room at numerous tables.  They gave us 1 waitress, and it took forever to be served. Orders were mixed up etc. It wasnt her fault, it was too much for one person. We are now waiting for our bills, its been 45 minutes and counting.  I will never return here.
Monique and the staff are excellent. Remembered our last trip almost to the date. Missed by 24 hours! WOW!!!!!

We were here for a "date" weekend and this was recommended by a friend that is from Chicago.  We reserved through opentable and I requested one of the tables by the window.  When we got there, they had a table for us exactly where we requested.  The food was nothing short of amazing as well as the service from Joe, our waiter.  He was extremely knowledgeable and handled several tables effortlessly. As we were leaving, we were about to call an Uber back to the hotel and Earnest offered us a complimentary ride in the "Chop House Chariot" and engaged in some great conversation along the way.  This place is now solid at the top of the "must go" list for when we visit Chicago again.

The place is so cool and amazing. I had around 15 friends of mine and the people at this place took care of all our needs. Moreover, everybody at this place gathered around to wish me on my birthday. The staff was very generous and considerate.
Great wait staff. Great food.
Good steak, medium Rare!

The BEST steak I have ever had! the dry aged tomahawk was amazing. Sides were great also. My wife said that the lobster bisque is the best she had ever tasted. The shrimp cocktail was enormous.  For the finally the lava cake finishes it all off. Great service all around also. Will be coming back soon and will bring friends.
1st time here and it was thee bomb!
All unhealthy food. Not even one item on the menu with real food. All processed products

Food was good. Service was far from amazing. Waiter spoke a million words a minute. Ordered shrimp appetizer and was told we were over served shrimp and that we would be responsible paying for it. After a short discussion the waiter retracted his statement and did not charge us for the extra shrimp he brought us. Overall was okay. Probably will find another steak house when we want a Chicago steak dinner.

The best steakhouse in the city. Very expensive but all professional and great tests. It’s bit small and seats are kinda limited. You probably want to make a reservation if you are going with a group or weekend.
Great steaks and great service
The steak was so over-salted that I couldn’t even taste the meat anymore. Don’t waste $80 on an overpriced piece of meat that was obviously salted AFTER it was cooked.
Been here several times!  Never again. Chris our waiter had a high dollar table and totally ignored our $400 table. Will never return.

This was our first time to the chop house.  We had reserved a high top.  The hostess said this is your first time here and new it was our night out, she said you need to sit upstairs by the window.  Great recommendation.  Food was delicious and service was excellent.
Fantastic. Cooked perfectly and has a wonderful atmosphere.
The ambience was fantastic while they also served a delicious steak. They had great service, and the server explained to us there different ways they have their steaks before it is cooked
Will be here again and again

Ok so I had to give this steakhouse 5 stars wish I could have given more , 1st off when I called to make reservation they accomadated me even though they were booked and got me a table for my birthday. Now I must say Christopher and The gm made me feel absolutely confortable , and delivered the best customer service . Now let me talk about the food , I’m obsessed with there lobster Mac and cheese that’s all I can think about. Loved how Chris explained the steaks at first I was skeptical about trying dry aged but he didn’t lie the dry aged was the best , steak was seasoned perfect . The lamb chops are most definitely a must try . Over all my experience here was amazing and I will be coming back maybe alone so I can eat my lobster Mac all by myself lol thank you guys for making my birthday amazing .
Great food, great service. A Chicago classic.
Best steakhouse
Live music, atmosphere was great! Drinks a bit costly.
Great setting, live music, an impressive selection of premium steaks and a staff that definitely know their meat!
Absolutely delicious! Mishima Ranch 20oz ribeye lobster mac and Nueske bacon. Amazing! Take a picture with the Tommy gun while you are there.
A very, very, VERY good restaraunt. Everything's amazing accept the dim lighting that hurts your eyes.
Great food.
Everyone raves about this place. I think it was just a bad night when I was there. Maybe I'll try again.

(Translated by Google) Emblematic, very good meat, acceptable prices, good service, easily accessible location, always full, but at the bar the wait is short  (Original) Emblemático, muy buena carne, precios aceptables, buen servicio, ubicación de fácil acceso, siempre lleno, pero en el bar la espera de hace corta
Cozy, great service. Exquisite cuts of beef.

First I will start by saying we have never been treated like this at any restaurant and we dine out occasionally. Me and my fiancé went here lastnight for the first time for dinner. Granted it was busy and we understood that, the host sat us down on the second floor after sitting and waiting for 30 min we noticed to other tables where guest was sitting was serviced immediately who came in after us. It was two married couples sitting next to us that came in after us but was seen before us they offered us they menu because no one still came to our table. My fiancé said no I’m going to get a manager, after speaking to a manager he came over to take our orders. The food servers were so rude to us they knocked my purse down 3 times and bumped my chair but never said sorry. Through y’all of this we never got a waiter or waitress at our table. The couple next to us that was from New England seen how a young black couple was being treated and they paid for our meal they exact words were no one from a great city should be treated like this. The manager gave us his card on the way out and told us to book through him next time, how we were treated was wrong, unfair, and disgusting. But the manager Tony Britos was very nice he was the one who made sure we got our drinks and took our order.

Service was lacking,  sides are over priced and not worth the extra money. Can't help but wonder if the gratuity was not automatically assessed maybe it would have been better.  Worst of all my steak was  slightly over cooked and not properly rested, as the evidence was on the plate.  Overall a disappointing experience.
Great service and fabulous food
Best steak place in the world. Everyone should eat here.

I've been here before and something changed...and for the better!  I like my steak rare and my service excellent.  I got both.  I honestly forgot about this place until I saw some reason buzz on facebook.
Absolutely the best in steaks. The dry rub 8 oz filet was amazing!  The best I have ever had. Our friend had the prime rib which was huge and very tasty as well!!

We came here to celebrate 2 birthdays Saturday evening 9/15/18 I have been dining here for over 15 years and have never experienced such a situation as we did that evening My home is located just about an hour away from the Chop House I ordered a lobster bisque soup and there was what appeared to look like an eyelash in the soup there was also hair in my corn and one of our guest had hair in her baked potatoes THAT IS HAIR IN 3 DIFFERENT DISHES! I ate about 4 or five pieces of my steak before we noticed the hair in the corn once I saw the hair of course I was TOTALLY DISGUSTED the thought of eating someone’s hair left me LITERALLY sick to my stomach! I asked for a full refund instead I was given $50 certificate to come back and eat more hair I reached out to the owner and he also refused to give me a refund I feel like we were treated unfairly and I’ts very disappointing and hurtful that something like this could happen in a 5 Star establishment I’ve never made any threats about posting anything online that’s A COMPLETE LIE!!!! I would love for you to post that email because I too have the emails that we shared and never once did I display disrespect or threats all that is displayed is disappointment and hurt from one of your customers and to sit here and try to defame my character is just sad and pathetic!!
Poor service, ok food.
Would give 5 stars but Waiter dumped my beer on the back and neck of one of the people at my table. Staff seemed to alot better in prior visits then my last time there.
Awesome food at a neat old place.
Top quality steaks.

Went here last night and ordered the 24 oz Tomahawk Ribeye and it was by far the best steak I have ever had. The appetizers were awesome. The staff was great and attentive. Great atmosphere will definitely go back next time I am in town!!
Excellent wait staff, management and a great steak. What a restaurant should be
Excellent food and service.
(Translated by Google) delicious.  (Original) 美味しい。
Great food, mellow surroundings, wish I could give it 1,000 stars
Poor service, got right in but waited for service. Will not go back unless I am forced.
Amazing steaks and sides. Definitely a must-eat for first time visitors to Chicago

We came here because we had a gift certificate for dinner. We ordered for starters the lamb lollipops and the crab cake. Lamb was pretty good, the crab cake was great! Next for the entree we ordered the small lobster tail (which is about half the size of a normal) and the Ny strip on the bone. Both were good but wasn’t great or a place to come back to again. What I will say about it is that our server a young Indian girl was extremely attentive. She took the time to explain the menu and the different cuts of meat. Prob one of the best waitresses I’ve ever had. She deserves five plus starts but this place I’d say 3/3.5.
Incredible steak, excellent service, and good times

Great place, great atmosphere. A must go for a steak dinner in Chicago. Only reason for the 4 stars was the steak I ordered was undercooked... . I always order one above what I want. So I order medium well. And it comes medium. This time I ordered medium well and it came rare. But the meat was such high quality it was delicious!
Staff is great. New ownership is amazing and the food is to die for. Gotta get the Oysters Rockefeller!
Great food and service!  The staff was very acomodating!

I did not get to eat here because the restaurant was not wheelchair accessible. They hang their hat on being a "historical building" which I understand, but making a place accessible doesn't always require altering the building. I have been to many older buildings where they invest in $200 ramp that can be stored in a closet and used to allow  a wheelchair user to roll up or down the 3 to 4 steps into the building or in this case the dinin g room.  Very disappointing.
If you tryna find a chop spot that sells chop steak and you want to find a place that’s going to chop your account balance right down the middle, this is the place for you

This place used to be so much better. I felt almost ignored by our waitress after I told her I didn't want the Wine List. My Steak was excellent but, I didn't even get one refill for my soda. For these prices you should be waited on and not totally ignored.

I live in Chicago recently and I have to only give this place only 4 Stars.  5 stars for ambiance and 3.5 for food quality.  It is a true Chicago institution famous for expense accounts and those with caviar and champagne pocket books.  Expect around 100.00 a person which is fair for the ambiance, location, and for sightseeing as in people.  Enjoy on a weekend trip or take a special someone out for a night.

We had the tomahawk wagyu ribeye here (big enough to serve my six year old son, my wife, and myself) and I was blown away. Probably the best steak I've ever consumed! It's one of the things we really wanted to do during our stay in Chicago, and I'll cherish the memory until I visit again!  We had a few sides as well, that were well prepared, but honestly, just a distraction from the steak.  I did start with the lobster bisque, and I would highly recommend starting with that. Really quite exceptional.  And finally, the staff was phenomenal. Super friendly and helpful. Which is nice since some servers don't enjoy waiting on children (which I get.) the staff came by and chatted with him, giving us all some laughs and enhancing our experience. We are also non-drinkers, and they suggested some delicious non-alcoholic cocktails that were enjoyed.  Everything about our experience was top notch. I recommend checking it out.
Amazing steaks, sides and desserts. Chopped salad was fantastic too. Menu is definitely pricey, but a fantastic meal for sure!
Amazing food. Great atmosphere. Amazing service. 10/10
Steak was not very tasty....we ended up taking ours home and adding our own seasonings and spices...mashed potatoes tasted like box mashed potatoes. Was a nice atmosphere. Very expensive.

Steak is overpriced and waiter tried to push most expensive cuts on us .. dry aged meat is a rip off without taste like normal wet aged steaks. Upstairs dining room was like an igloo, freezing cold AC, dinner went cold very quickly, we were frozen before could finish meal. Key lime pie is probably the worst I’ve had .. bland .. downstairs lounge may be better with live music but we were excluded because had 19y old son .. to be avoided
Very good, but I have better steaks for the price I paid

Make reservations,  dress is informal.  Come to spend money.   If you go all out to have a nice meal,  the wine selection is top notch.   But pricey.  At first, we were told we had window seating but then they changed it, disappointing.   The tomahawk ribeye, aged and rubbed, was underwhelming.   Not the best I've had, I expected a thicker cut ribeye.  Our server provided excellent advice on wine, we took a bottle home with us.  But we had one other server that I felt was trying too hard to sell us wine, seemed a bit too suggestive.  Would definitely come back and try again.  Great dark wood and ambiance.

Treated like Royalty from the moment I walked in and Royal Family by the time I left. The food is Ah-Mazing! Local and a lot of history. Not disappointed. James was our server and was an awesome addition to our dinner experience :)

We had an excellent experience at the Chop House a couple of weeks ago when we were visiting CHI...we went in for happy hour martinis+snacks at the bar and stayed for dinner  The food and service was great...we had the crab cake, oysters, sliced ahi tuna and a thick sliced hanging bacon dish(it wasn’t on the menu when we were there, just a special) and for mains we had a wet-aged bone in Kansas City and a dry aged bone in ribeye...both were excellent, I preferred the dry aged, but the wet aged was very good too ;)...+ a nice wine selection to chose from :)  It was a great environment, met some nice locals through the night...We will definitely be back next time we visit CHI :)
Great steak, wine and service
The fire e stats are for the waiter. The sides we're amazing and and the steaks we're very good. The valet sucked.

The service was excellent, some of the best you will have anywhere. The food was below average. I’ve had better steak at Outback Steakhouse, I went to chili’s the next day and spent a tenth of what I spent at the Chophouse and had better food. The steak was poorly marbled, I can’t even describe the hollandaise sauce in a way the describes it, and the Oscar horrible. I will never visit this restaurant again. Save your money and go to Texas Roadhouse, you’ll probably enjoy it more.

As a tourist, i didnt know that the resturant was as high class as i thought and my boyfriend and i walked in and the host was so judgemental bc we were dresses wayy too casual and it was annoying because we have money like we were ready to drop whatever to pay for a nice dinner. The waitress was so sweet and didnt judge us it seemed and the food was amazing
Everything we had was delicious and the staff was very attentive.
Amazing.  Perfect.

Edit: I contacted the owner as he asked me to below and I was very impressed that he took my complaint seriously. Evidently a couple of other diners had sub-par steak so they contacted their supplier and got rid of a bad batch of steaks. He made good and refunded me for the steaks and invited us back to dine there if we ever returned to Chicago. I mentioned we didn't have plans to go back in the near future but were looking to visit Nashville and he kindly gave me his email for recommendations for places to eat there. I was impressed by his willingness to "make things right" and now wouldn't hesitate to try this place again. End Edit I’ve been to all the chain steakhouses like Morton’s, Fleming’s, etc. and wanted a local place for a steakhouse “experience”. Tried to get reservations two days ahead to a competitor but no time slots available except 5 or 9pm. I should’ve been suspicious when this place had a ton of open time slots.  Place had decent decor, good service and strong wine list. However, you come for the beef! My wife got dry aged filet and I opted for the 10oz. Waygu strip steak having never tried the Waygu before. Well it was very underwhelming. Thin and grizzly and it was no better than $6.99/lb. cuts I get at the local supermarket and grill at home. My wife’s filet was dry and tough by filet standards. Some may ask why didn’t I complain but it was late, we were getting tired and the app, salad and potatoes filled us up so didn’t want to wait for them to cook up another piece.
The steak was very tender but not very flavorful

I came here recently for a VIP yelp elite event,  Having not been to the Chop House for a while, I was really looking forward to revisiting.  Great drinks, I had the King's Bee's Knee's (Bulleit Bourbon, Honey, and fresh lemon) and the Purple Valentine (Grey Goose, Chambord, Fresh lemon and a touch of sugar), my favorite!  We had a great variety of food:  lobster rolls, tuna tartare, steak tartare, duke of bacon, Burrata-wrapped prosciutto, chicken sliders, and prime angus prime rib sliders.  The first/garden floor is dedicated to Chicago gangsters and Chicago mayors.  This is very visible from the outside with the black "mobster style" car that is right outside the restaurant on the east side. The 2nd floor is dedicated to the "Builders of Chicago" and the 3rd is dedicated to Chicago's history including restaurants, buildings, trains, and musicians.  I missed the tour of all 3 floors and behind the scenes that was given by the new owner, Matthew and hope to check out the 2nd and 3rd floors on my next visit.  They have teamed up with Frank Calabrese Jr. and his ride along tour of Chicago mob sites.  Will definitely come back for either dinner or drinks and appetizers here when I come back for Frank Calabrese Jr's "Family Secrets organized crime tour".
My favorite fine dining restaurant in the country.  Tremendous steaks and the service was truly five star
Great service and food outstanding from start to finish

(Translated by Google) A steak restaurant that you'll want to visit once you come to Chicago. Enjoy live music and enjoy the steak to your heart's content. There are many kinds of meat, so it is difficult to choose. Especially, I am worried about whether to choose dry aged. If you've eaten Chicago steaks many times, it's a good experience to choose dry aged. If this is your first time, normal wet aged is safe.  The soup made from the recommended lobster costs over $ 10, but it's really good.  (Original) シカゴに来たら一度は行きたいステーキレストラン。 生演奏を楽しみ、ステーキを心ゆくまで堪能できる。 肉の種類が多いので、選ぶのに苦労する。 特にdry agedを選ぶかどうかで悩む。 シカゴのステーキを何度も食べているのなら、経験としてdry agedを選ぶのも良いが 初めてならば、通常のwet agedが無難。  オススメのロブスターから出汁をとったスープは$10以上するが、激ウマい。

The Chicago Chop House....true gem! When dining here you definitely receive more than just a great steak. We are Chicago Natives and now ashamed we have never been here for dinner. I’m unsure what excited my husband and myself more, the service, the food or the ambiance from the history of the building! James was our extremely knowledgeable server whom educated us on the cuts of meat and has thee perfect recommendations. We decided to go with a Dry Aged Ribeye, Lamb Chops with Mint Jelly and Asparagus with Hollandaise sauce. All I can say is...truly phenomenal! We also decided to go with a Moscato & Prosecco which were a perfect pairing for our meal. The dessert we had was just shy of sinful! My husband and myself also met a few other gears that have The Chicago Chop House well oiled, Matthew & Doris. They put the cherry on top! We are Forever Grateful for such a wonderful experience!!!! We will return very soon!

Your QUINTESSENTIAL Chicago steakhouse. Before you go running all over town trying all the others, put this and/or Gibsons at the top of your list first so you understand what the great steakhouses of Chicago should be like.

When judging a place like the Chop House I take a lot of different things in to account, add them up and give my personal feedback.  Have I had better steaks, yes.  Have I found better bars, yes, but only a few.  Have I found better values, well... that depends on what you are looking for.  I have been to the Chop House dozens of times and have always enjoyed myself.  I chose to sit downstairs where I could have a cigar, a great steak and enjoy the piano.  The bartenders were some of the best that I have ever met and I have been in a lot of bars.  I have entertained many clients there and they were always happy.  I haven't been back in a while but it remains one of my favorite restaurants.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!  *This review is for a party of 3*  I heard about the new owners/management of Chop House...and I had to try it out.  Came here with my friends from out of town and since it was their first time in Chicago, I was nervous as I wanted to make a great impression for dinner...WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED!  Really had the Irish old school Chicago feel.. The food --outstanding.  We had shrimp to start (The cocktail sauce is amazing),  and I had the  ribeye which was absolutely phenomenal... One of my friends had the lobster bisque soup and she was raving about the flavor.  My other buddy had the grand porterhouse and had to bag the rest of it for home because of the sheer size!... 1 quick mention:  Our server and manager? were very attentive and kind.  Chicago hospitality at its finest. Thank you Chop House.

Took Mom for her birthday!! This is the 4th Chop House I've been to and they never disappoint!! Yes, each one is independently owned and operated, but they follow a formula and it works!! The best steak, perfectly cooked side dishes, sauces made from scratch, team customer service, and attention to detail... It TOTALLY WORKS!! The manager learned it was my mom's birthday and requested Motown songs from the pianist on the baby Grand.. Never heard R & B like that, but it was thoughtful and appreciated👍🏾👍🏾. They even surprised my mom with a slice of birthday cake!! Highly recommend this Chop House.  Oh, and the walls are decorated with memorabilia photos of Chicago.. Including the Mayors since the 1800s!!

A must visit anytime we visit family in Chicago. The waygu style beef is outstanding and my go to is the bone-in ribeye. Our party had a variety of steaks and each was great in its own right. The appetizers were solid, fresh shrimp, good scallops. Salad was salad haha. But let’s be real, you’re there for the steaks and they were superb.  Great bar and wine selection.
